Tokio.name: Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden
Tokio.description: Uno de los parques más grandes y populares de Tokio, con jardines de estilo inglés, francés y japonés.

Tokio.name: Omoide Yokocho
Tokio.description: Conocido como "Piss Alley", es un callejón estrecho lleno de pequeños bares y restaurantes de yakitori.

Tokio.name: Kabukicho
Tokio.description: El distrito de entretenimiento más grande de Japón, lleno de bares, restaurantes y vida nocturna.

Tokio.name: Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building (Tocho)
Tokio.description: Ofrece vistas panorámicas gratuitas de la ciudad desde sus dos observatorios a 202 metros de altura.

Tokio.name: Santuario Meiji Jingu
Tokio.description: Santuario sintoísta dedicado a los espíritus deificados del Emperador Meiji y su esposa.

Tokio.name: Takeshita Street
Tokio.description: El epicentro de la cultura adolescente y la moda de Harajuku, famosa por sus tiendas y crepes.

Tokio.name: Cruce de Shibuya
Tokio.description: El cruce peatonal más transitado del mundo, un espectáculo de luces de neón y multitudes.

Tokio.name: Estatua de Hachiko
Tokio.description: Famosa estatua de bronce que conmemora al leal perro Akita, Hachiko. Punto de encuentro popular.

Tokio.name: Templo Senso-ji
Tokio.description: El templo más antiguo de Tokio, en Asakusa, con su icónica linterna roja gigante.

Tokio.name: Kaminarimon (Puerta del Trueno)
Tokio.description: La imponente puerta de entrada al Templo Senso-ji, un símbolo de Asakusa.

Tokio.name: Parque Ueno
Tokio.description: Gran parque público que alberga museos, templos y un zoológico.

Tokio.name: Mercado Ameya Yokocho (Ameyoko)
Tokio.description: Animado mercado al aire libre que vende de todo, desde mariscos hasta ropa.

Tokio.name: Estación de Tokio
Tokio.description: Hito arquitectónico con una hermosa fachada de ladrillo rojo, principal centro de trenes de Japón.

Tokio.name: Templo Gotokuji
Tokio.description: Famoso por ser el origen del Maneki-neko (gato de la suerte), con miles de estatuillas de gatos.

Tokio.name: Tokyo Skytree
Tokio.description: La estructura más alta de Japón, con vistas espectaculares desde sus observatorios.

Tokio.name: Palacio Imperial
Tokio.description: La residencia principal del Emperador de Japón, rodeada de grandes jardines y fosos.

Tokio.name: 3Coins+plus
Tokio.description: Tienda popular con artículos para el hogar y accesorios, la mayoría por menos de ¥300.

Tokio.name: Alinamin Night Recover
Tokio.description: Bebida de recuperación en 7-Eleven, útil para el jet lag.

Tokio.name: Nikkō
Tokio.description: A city in the mountains of Tochigi Prefecture, Nikko is a popular day trip from Tokyo known for its ornate shrines and temples. (Note: A day trip is recommended due to the distance from Tokyo)

Tokio.name: Kawagoe
Tokio.description: A city near Tokyo known for its well-preserved Edo-period architecture. (Note: This is a good option for a day trip from Tokyo)

Tokio.name: Kamakura
Tokio.description: A coastal city south of Tokyo with numerous Buddhist temples and Shinto shrines.

Tokio.name: Yokohama
Tokio.description: A major city south of Tokyo known for its modern architecture and scenic waterfront.

Tokio.name: Enoshima
Tokio.description: A small island with hot springs, English-style gardens, a sacred sanctuary, caves, and a lighthouse.

Tokio.name: Templo Kotoku-in
Tokio.description: A serene temple famous for its large outdoor bronze statue of a seated Buddha.

Tokio.name: Engaku-ji
Tokio.description: A Zen Buddhist complex, founded in 1282, with gates, temples, a giant bell, and a Buddha relic.

Tokio.name: Templo Hokoku-ji
Tokio.description: An old temple with a lush bamboo garden and a teahouse serving matcha to visitors.

Tokio.name: Zeniarai Benten Shrine
Tokio.description: A cozy, 11th-century Shinto shrine with a spring for ritual money-washing believed to increase wealth.

Tokio.name: Templo Gōtokuji
Tokio.description: Edo period Buddhist temple with a large collection of lucky beckoning cat statues.

Tokio.name: Starbucks Reserve® Roastery Tokyo
Tokio.description: A Seattle-based cafe known for its specialty coffees and snacks, with Wi-Fi.

Tokio.name: Nintendo Tokio
Tokio.description: The official Nintendo store in Tokyo.

Tokio.name: RURU SHIBUYA
Tokio.description: A restaurant in the Shibuya area.

Tokio.name: Shibuya
Tokio.description: A famous commercial and entertainment district in Tokyo.

Tokio.name: Meiji Park
Tokio.description: A large public park in Tokyo.

Tokio.name: Templo Zojoji
Tokio.description: A temple complex with the main temple of the Jodo-shu Buddhist school and ornate 17th-century buildings.

Tokio.name: Tsukiji Outer Market
Tokio.description: An extensive fish market with a variety of seafood and areas to watch the famous tuna auction.

Tokio.name: Ginza
Tokio.description: An upscale shopping, dining, and entertainment district in Tokyo.

Tokio.name: Santuario Hie
Tokio.description: A complex of Shinto shrines and gardens that hosts several annual festivals and events.

Tokio.name: Ayuntamiento de Tokio
Tokio.description: A government complex with observation decks that offer some of the highest views in the city.

Tokio.name: SHARI Tokyu Kabukicho Tower
Tokio.description: A restaurant located in the Tokyu Kabukicho Tower.

Tokio.name: Omoide Yokochō- Callejón de los Recuerdos
Tokio.description: An iconic alley with a selection of simple food stalls and alcoholic beverages.

Tokio.name: Shinjuku
Tokio.description: A major commercial and administrative center in Tokyo.

Tokio.name: Hotel Chinzanso Tokyo
Tokio.description: A refined hotel with several restaurants, lush gardens, a spa, and an indoor pool.

Tokio.name: Akihabara
Tokio.description: A commercial district famous for its electronics, toys, and manga, as well as its maid cafes.

Tokio.name: Benitsuru Pancake
Tokio.description: A selection of sweet & savory pancakes are offered at this easygoing restaurant with counter seats.

Tokio.name: Asakusa
Tokio.description: A traditional district with an ancient Buddhist temple, street food stalls, artisan shops, and more.

Tokio.name: Sensō-ji
Tokio.description: Tokyo's oldest temple, completed in the year 645, in honor of Kannon, goddess of mercy.

Tokio.name: Parque de Ueno
Tokio.description: An urban park with wide walking paths, a lake with boat rentals, a zoo, and museums.

Kioto.name: Kiyomizu-dera
Kioto.description: Famoso por su terraza de madera que sobresale de la ladera, con vistas impresionantes.

Kioto.name: Otagi Nenbutsu-ji
Kioto.description: Templo encantador famoso por sus 1,200 estatuas de Rakan con expresiones diferentes.

Kioto.name: Kinkaku-ji (Pabellón Dorado)
Kioto.description: Impresionante templo Zen cuyas dos plantas superiores están cubiertas de pan de oro.

Kioto.name: Ginkaku-ji (Pabellón de Plata)
Kioto.description: Elegante templo Zen con hermosos jardines de arena y musgo.

Kioto.name: Palacio Imperial de Kioto
Kioto.description: Antigua residencia de la Familia Imperial, ubicada en un extenso parque.

Kioto.name: Torre de Kioto
Kioto.description: La estructura de acero más alta de Kioto, con vistas de 360 grados.

Kioto.name: Fushimi Inari-taisha
Kioto.description: Famoso por sus miles de puertas torii de color bermellón en un sendero montañoso.

Kioto.name: Barrio de Gion
Kioto.description: El famoso distrito de geishas de Kioto, con casas de té y calles bien conservadas.

Kioto.name: Mercado Nishiki
Kioto.description: Estrecha calle comercial con tiendas y restaurantes que venden especialidades locales.

Kioto.name: Adashino Nenbutsuji Temple
Kioto.description: Serene hilltop Buddhist temple featuring thousands of carved stone memorial statues.

Kioto.name: Arashiyama Bamboo Forest
Kioto.description: A popular sightseeing path runs uphill through this forest of towering bamboo stalks.

Kioto.name: Tenryu-ji
Kioto.description: This venerable Zen temple at the foot of mountains features teahouses & serene, expansive gardens.

Kioto.name: Arashiyama Monkey Park Iwatayama
Kioto.description: Popular area atop Mt. Arashiyama for viewing wild macaque monkeys & sweeping city views.

Kioto.name: Ryōan-ji
Kioto.description: On the scenic grounds of this 15th-century temple is a famous Zen rock garden & a yudofu restaurant.

Kioto.name: Kinkaku-ji
Kioto.description: Historic, tranquil temple with a gold-leaf facade set amid landscaped gardens & a reflecting pond.

Kioto.name: Pontocho Park
Kioto.description: A small park in the Pontocho alley, a famous district with traditional teahouses and restaurants.

Kioto.name: Yasaka Shrine
Kioto.description: A Shinto shrine erected in 656 A.D. & home to one of the most famous festivals in Japan.

Kioto.name: Gion Misen
Kioto.description: Relaxed hotel in a townhouse featuring streamlined rooms, artwork & complimentary Wi-Fi.

Kioto.name: Sannenzaka
Kioto.description: Bustling pedestrian street on a hill lined with souvenir stalls & traditional Japanese architecture.

Kioto.name: Kiyomizu-dera
Kioto.description: Iconic Buddhist temple on Mount Otowa known for the scenic views afforded from its sizable veranda.

Kioto.name: Sanjūsangendō Temple
Kioto.description: This iconic Buddhist temple is known for its 1,001 life-sized wooden statues of the goddess Kannon.

Kioto.name: Ginkaku-ji
Kioto.description: This 15th-century Zen temple features picturesque gardens & a sand mound shaped like Mount Fuji.

Kioto.name: Kibune River
Kioto.description: The Kibune River is famous for its Kibune Kawadoko restaurants, where visitors can enjoy meals on platforms built over the river.

Kioto.name: Hirobun
Kioto.description: Delicately presented banquet menus at a charming spot with tatami flooring & overlooking a weir.

Osaka.name: Mercado Kuromon
Osaka.description: Mercado cubierto conocido por su marisco fresco, carne y productos locales.

Osaka.name: Castillo de Osaka
Osaka.description: Uno de los castillos más famosos de Japón, con museo y mirador.

Osaka.name: Shinsekai
Osaka.description: Distrito con aire retro, famoso por la Torre Tsutenkaku y la comida kushikatsu.

Osaka.name: Dotonbori
Osaka.description: El corazón de la vida nocturna de Osaka, con luces de neón y restaurantes.

Osaka.name: Umeda Sky Building
Osaka.description: Espectacular rascacielos con un observatorio al aire libre que conecta sus dos torres.

Osaka.name: Noria Hep Five
Osaka.description: Gran noria roja en un centro comercial, con excelentes vistas.

Osaka.name: Barco Santa María
Osaka.description: Réplica del barco de Colón que ofrece cruceros por la bahía de Osaka.

Osaka.name: Namba
Osaka.description: Principal centro de entretenimiento y compras del sur de Osaka.

Osaka.name: Katsuoji
Osaka.description: Centuries-old Buddhist temple & gardens known for fall colors & thousands of red Daruma dolls.

Osaka.name: Osaka Castle
Osaka.description: Revered castle dating to 1597 & since rebuilt, featuring gardens & a museum with varied exhibits.

Osaka.name: Dekasan
Osaka.description: Dekasan specializes in delicious udon and soba noodles.

Osaka.name: Doutonbori Street
Osaka.description: A popular street in the Dotonbori area, known for its vibrant nightlife and food scene.

Osaka.name: Kuromon Market
Osaka.description: A covered market known for its fresh seafood, meat and local produce.

Osaka.name: Nipponbashi
Osaka.description: Popular urban stretch of alleys & arcades with shops specializing in various discount electronics.

Osaka.name: Shitennoji Ishinotorii
Osaka.description: Stone torii gate located at the Shitennoji temple complex.

Osaka.name: Magic Cafe & Bar Shinsekai
Osaka.description: A cafe and bar in the Shinsekai district known for its magic shows.

Osaka.name: Sumiyoshi Taisha
Osaka.description: Shinto shrine with a peaceful garden, plus structures rebuilt repeatedly since the 3rd century.

Nara.name: Parque de los Ciervos de Nara
Nara.description: Gran parque con cientos de ciervos sika que deambulan libremente.

Nara.name: Tōdai-ji
Nara.description: Impresionante templo que alberga una de las estatuas de Buda de bronce más grandes del mundo.

Nara.name: Nakatani-dou
Nara.description: Famosa tienda de mochi donde se puede ver el tradicional y rápido machacado del arroz.

Nara.name: Barrio de Naramachi
Nara.description: Antiguo barrio de comerciantes de Nara, con casas tradicionales y tiendas.

Nara.name: Kōfuku-ji
Nara.description: Complejo de templos con una impresionante pagoda de cinco pisos, la segunda más alta de Japón.

Nara.name: Horyu-ji
Nara.description: Buddhist temple with frescoes, statues & the world's oldest wooden buildings on its grounds.

Nara.name: Yakushi-ji
Nara.description: Originally built in 680, this Buddhist landmark was once one of the Seven Great Temples in Nara.

Nara.name: Nara Park
Nara.description: Landscaped, public park with ancient temples & the Nara National Museum of art, plus tame deer.

Nara.name: Kasugataisha Shrine
Nara.description: Bright vermillion columns support the roof of this Shinto shrine originally established in 768 A.D..

Nara.name: Isuien Garden and Neiraku Museum
Nara.description: Sizable collection of ancient Chinese bronze wares, mirrors & seals, along with Korean pottery.

Nara.name: Hasedera Temple
Nara.description: This rebuilt 8th-century temple serves as the primary temple for the Buzan sect of Shingon Buddhism.

Nara.name: Ryuo-ga-buchi
Nara.description: A tranquil lake known for its beautiful reflections, especially during the autumn season.

Nara.name: Murou-ji
Nara.description: This Buddhist temple dates back some 1400 years & unusually for its time, has always admitted women.

Nara.name: Tsubosaka-dera
Nara.description: Temple from 717 AD with Japanese & Indian influences & a large Buddha statue amidst cherry trees.

Hakone.name: Chureito Pagoda
Hakone.description: Pagoda con vistas icónicas del Monte Fuji. Se encuentra cerca de la región de Hakone.

Hakone.name: Fujikawaguchiko
Hakone.description: A town located on the north shore of Lake Kawaguchi, offering stunning views of Mount Fuji.

Hakone.name: Chureito Pagoda
Hakone.description: Iconic pagoda on a hilltop facing Mt. Fuji in Arakurayama Sengen Park, reached via 398 steps. (This is a duplicate and will be ignored)

Hakone.name: Fuji Five Lakes
Hakone.description: A collection of five lakes at the base of Mount Fuji, offering picturesque views and various recreational activities.

Hakone.name: Oshino Hakkai
Hakone.description: A small and picturesque village with eight ponds, views of Mount Fuji, and food and souvenir vendors.

Hakone.name: Owakudani
Hakone.description: A volcanic valley with active sulfur vents and hot springs.

Hakone.name: Woven City Construction Office
Hakone.description: The construction office for Woven City, a prototype smart city by Toyota.

General.name: Tren Spacia X
General.description: Tren que conecta Tokio y Nikko en ~2 horas. Costo: ~$15 por tramo.

General.name: Tren Saphir Odoriko
General.description: Tren de lujo y panorámico que recorre la península de Izu desde Tokio. Costo: ~$50.

General.name: Tren Aoniyoshi
General.description: Tren turístico que conecta Osaka, Nara y Kioto. Costo: ~$5.
